item.title: How to get startup ideas?
item.description:
How to get startup ideas?

The way to get startup ideas is not to try to think of startup ideas. It's to look for problems, preferably problems you have yourself. The very best startup ideas tend to have three things in common: they're something the founders themselves want, that they themselves can build, and that few others realize are worth doing. Microsoft, Apple, Yahoo, Google, and Facebook all began this way.

item.title: 50 wearable tech gamechangers for 2016
item.description:
50 wearable tech gamechangers for 2016

It's that time of year once again when the Wareable team set aside thoughts of mince pies and look ahead to what's in store for wearable tech in 2016. In last year's Wareable 50, we correctly pointed out that the Apple Watch (surprise, surprise), Xiaomi and Tag Heuer would be grabbing the headlines.

item.title: LQD PALO | frogdesign.com
item.description:
LQD PALO | frogdesign.com

Palo connects people to essential information, resources and safety by offering free wifi, information on nearby attractions, restaurants, retail and events, volunteering opportunities and community groups, public service announcements, maps and way finding, emergency alerts, meeting points and taxi beacons.

item.title: Maform
item.description:
Maform

Shark Airship Shuttle is an aircraft concept, which is the mixture of a traditional airship and an airplane. It is capable of hovering as an airship and also capable of gliding by decreasing the buoyancy.

item.title: Customer needs are always changing. How do brands stay relevant?
item.description:

Method creates solutions for our clients that help them build relevance today and into the future.
